Title: AI Developer
Description:
Axiomatic_AI's mission:

Axiomatic_AI is launching with the aim to accelerate R&D by "Automated Interpretable Reasoning" (AIR) -- a verifiably truthful AI model built for reasoning in science and engineering. Axiomatic_AI is hiring top talent interested in a future of human reasoning aided by -- not replaced by -- AI, and a future that empowers a new generation of innovators to solve important problems through deep-tech engineering in the semiconductor ecosystem.


Responsibilities:
Take a leading role in designing and implementing advanced reasoning-AI architectures and algorithms, ensuring they are effective and scalable.
Translate project objectives into clear technical software requirements.
Develop cutting-edge AI and machine learning methods for engineering and science.
Work collaboratively with a team of machine learning researchers, deep-tech engineers, and physicists.
Qualifications:


Education: Master's degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science or a related field.

Expertise in machine learning, deep learning, and natural language processing.

Knowledge of AI algorithms and architectures.

Familiarity with industry-standard AI tools and libraries.

Strong research and analytical skills.

Plus: Experience in developing and deploying AI solutions for real-world problems.

Plus: Experience in working with large-scale datasets.


What We Offer:
A competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package.
The opportunity to work on pioneering projects that blend scientific research with practical hardware design.
A culture of learning & innovation ideal for professional development.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Who we are

At CoverWallet we are determined to revolutionize the insurance industry! We launched in 2015 and since then we are the leading digital platform for contracting insurance for small and medium-sized companies. Thanks to state-of-the-art technology and meticulous design we have turned insurance management and processing into a simple, fast and convenient process for our clients. All online, in minutes!




Our passion is in delivering innovation and value creation through technology, and our mission is to become the world’s leading InsurTech. For this, we have built an incredible team of ~800 people based in New York, Spain, Poland and Singapore. Success is guaranteed as we are part of Aon, the global leaders in risk, retirement and health solutions with 50,000 colleagues worldwide. We combine the mindset and culture of a high-growth startup with the backing and support of a global multinational. The best of both worlds in one company - what more could we ask for?




What you will do

We are looking for a highly motivated and skilled Data Scientist to join our dynamic Data Science team. Our mission is to drive innovation and leverage machine learning and data-driven solutions to solve strategic business challenges. You will work across various domains, including product, sales, marketing, and operations, impacting business outcomes at scale. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, enjoys solving complex problems, and is passionate about learning and leveraging data science to create real-world impact.




A typical day

Develop predictive models, advanced analytics solutions, and visualization tools for internal teams and end customers. Initial projects may include: scoring models for sales and customer service, recommendation systems, automation of repetitive tasks to improve efficiency.
Conduct complex analyses for business stakeholders, translating insights into actionable recommendations.
Own the feedback loop for testing and improving machine learning models.
Design, propose, and measure A/B tests for product features, ensuring alignment with business goals.
Identify data-driven opportunities to enhance different stages of the customer journey.
Collaborate with data engineering and infrastructure teams to develop scalable, end-to-end solutions.
Serve as a technical representative when engaging with external stakeholders.
Recommend and implement new technologies, processes, and systems to optimize efficiencies and business performance.
Maintain awareness of emerging trends in data science, machine learning, and technology.
Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code.
Produce detailed technical documentation and presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences.




What you need to succeed

BSc/BA in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Physics, Engineering, or a related field.
Around 4 - 5 years of experience as a Data Scientist
Strong communication skills to translate technical analysis into business insights.
Extensive experience with Python and data visualization frameworks (e.g., Plotly, Seaborn, Matplotlib).
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Experience with data modeling and statistical analysis.
Familiarity with cloud environments (Google Cloud, AWS, etc.).
Experience with cloud infrastructure and deployment processes.
Solid understanding of clean code principles and version control (Git).
Knowledge of Docker and containerization technologies.
Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment.
Nice to have: Experience in designing and measuring A/B tests.
Nice to have: Knowledge of Large Language Models (LLMs) and their applications.
Nice to have: Knowledge of best practices around service-oriented architectures or microservices.




About the recruitment process

Your first contact with CoverWallet will be through an HR interview with one of our colleagues from the Talent Acquisition area, who will tell you everything about our company and its history, as well as the details of the position, functions and your future conditions. We would love to know your professional and academic career, and of course, your motivations and expectations for a new professional project. We will be happy to answer all your questions!
Do we have a match? Let’s move on to your First Technical Interview! You will meet two of the colleagues from the Data Science team, who will explain to you in more detail what the team's day-to-day life is and its responsibilities. They will be very interested in expanding information about your experience as a Data Scientist as well as your knowledge of our main technological environments.
If everything has gone well and you have impressed our colleagues... we advance to the second stage of the process! We will send you a data challenge based on a case study to find out your technical level and you will have a maximum of 7 days to complete it.
If you've made it this far, things are getting interesting... It's time for your Final Interview! In this case, you will have the opportunity to meet one of our Heads of Data and Engineering, who will close the selection process with an interview aimed at getting to know you not only on a professional and technical level, but also on a personal level, so that both of you can reach the conclusion of whether the purpose of our project fits with your professional aspirations.




Why CoverWallet

At CoverWallet you will have the opportunity to be a key player in the transformation of one of the largest industries and in one of the most developed digital markets in the world. You will work in a cutting-edge tech environment, alongside a super powerful and diverse global team. Join us and build your own career plan in one of the world's leading companies, tailored to your dreams and aspirations! And just for good measure…




💰 Competitive salary based on your background and experience, and a variable annual bonus set according to your goals
⏰ Enjoy flexible working hours and find out your ideal way of working thanks to our smart work model: full remote or hybrid, it’s up to you!
🎁 Perks package consisting of a Company-paid Life, Accident Insurance and Medical Cover with free dental care. Complement your benefits with our flexible compensation plan (tickets restaurant, transport card, daycare checks, external training and even a Pension Scheme!)
📚 Carry on with your training thanks to your additional budget of 1,500€ per year to finance training courses, certifications, books or any teaching aids that will help you continue to grow professionally
🛒 Enjoy a lot of offers and save on your purchases thanks to our discount platform (BigPocket) on your favorite brands (travel, fashion, technology, leisure...)
🏝 23 paid vacation days per year, plus 2 additional personal days and 2 wellbeing days to focus on your own health and prioritize self-care :)
🍏 Great offices in Madrid, Valencia and Sevilla. Come and enjoy all the activities we do, both inside and outside the office (hackathons, meetups, tech talks, code katas and much more!)
Show more

Join us and build your own career plan in one of the world's leading companies, tailored to your dreams and aspirations! And just for good measure…


  • 💰 Competitive salary based on your background and experience, and a variable annual bonus set according to your goals

  • 🎁 Perks package consisting of a Company-paid Life, Accident Insurance and Medical Cover with free dental care. Complement your benefits with our flexible compensation plan (tickets restaurant, transport card, daycare checks, external training and even a Pension Scheme!)

Title: ML Engineer
Description:
We're building a next-generation Analytical Platform for a leading resort and entertainment group in Southeast Asia. The platform will combine large-scale data processing, real-time analytics, and machine learning to power decisions in marketing, customer personalization, operations, and risk management.

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, training, and deploying ML models that deliver business value across a wide range of use cases—such as dynamic pricing, customer segmentation, and predictive maintenance.

You'll collaborate closely with Data Engineers, Data Architects, Business Analysts, and DevOps to bring models from experimentation to production.

Requirements


4+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer
Proficiency in Python and ML libraries/frameworks (e.g., scikit-learn, PyTorch, TensorFlow)
Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms, data preprocessing, and evaluation techniques
Experience with ML lifecycle management, including versioning, retraining, and monitoring
Strong knowledge of data wrangling and feature engineering using large datasets
Familiarity with data processing frameworks (e.g., Spark, Pandas, Dask)
Experience building ML services and APIs for real-time or near real-time applications
Understanding of MLOps concepts and working within CI/CD pipelines for ML



Responsibilities:


Design, develop, and deploy machine learning models to support business cases like personalization, fraud detection, and customer value prediction
Build robust data pipelines for model training and inference using structured and semi-structured data
Perform feature engineering, model optimization, and validation using statistical and ML techniques
Work with Data Engineers to ensure data availability and quality across the ML lifecycle
Use tools for model tracking, versioning, and reproducibility (e.g., MLflow or equivalent)
Package models for deployment and integrate them with APIs, dashboards, or other systems
Monitor and maintain model performance in production and support retraining pipelines
Communicate results clearly to technical and non-technical stakeholders



Benefits


35 absence days per year for work-life balance
Udemy courses of your choice
English courses with native-speaker
Regular soft-skills trainings
Excellence Сenters meetups
Online/offline team-buildings
Business trips
Show more

Title: DEPENDIENTE/A ZONA CENTRO MADRID
Description:
En Mango inspiramos y unimos mediante nuestra pasión por el estilo y la cultura. Estamos en más de 115 países y nuestra presencia online se extiende a más de 110 países. Nuestro equipo está formado por personas de 112 nacionalidades y en un 78% por mujeres. En nuestro equipo somos proactivos y dinámicos, con habilidades comunicativas y siempre estamos abiertos a nuevos retos. Somos un equipo joven y multicultural, nos encanta el buen rollo que tenemos y trabajamos unidos para conseguir los resultados. Estamos informados de las tendencias y de la actualidad del mundo retail.

Buscamos un/a

DEPENDIENTE/A ZONA CENTRO MADRID

¿CÓMO SERÁ TU DÍA A DÍA EN MANGO?

¿Eres entusiasta, necesitas estar siempre en activo y rodeado/a de gente? ¿Te apasiona el mundo de la moda y te encanta aconsejar a los clientes? ¿Deseas formar parte de un equipo y ayudarnos a conseguir nuestros objetivos comerciales?

Valoraremos experiencia en un puesto similar.

Buscamos vendedores/as para la ZONA CENTRO de Madrid (c/ Preciados, Gran Vía, Plaza España, Serrano, Orense...) para trabajar en nuestras tiendas con diferentes tipos de turnos y horas.

Ofrecemos contratos tanto indefinidos como temporales.

¿QUÉ NOS HACE ESPECIALES?


Descuento en todas nuestras líneas (Woman, Man, Kids, Teen & Home)
Uniforme por temporada
Beneficios sociales y descuentos
Oportunidades de desarrollo constante con retos variados que generan aprendizaje en el puesto de trabajo
Posibilidades de crecimiento a otros puestos dentro de la estructura de Retail o de Headquarter
Formarás parte de una empresa líder en el sector de la moda, dinámica y con un ambiente de trabajo cercano, inspirador y ambicioso.


You got it?

We like you!

Title: recepcionista
Description:
Recepcionista

Empresa: CENTRO DE ESTUDIOS SOCRATES SL

Ubicación: Madrid

Experiencia requerida: 1 año

Descripción del puesto

En CENTRO DE ESTUDIOS SOCRATES SL, nos encontramos en la búsqueda de un recepcionista para importante despacho de abogados situado en Madrid. Este puesto es ideal para una persona dinámica, con dotes comerciales y habilidades de comunicación excelente, que se sienta cómoda en un entorno profesional y pueda colaborar eficazmente con nuestro equipo.

La persona seleccionada será responsable de la primera impresión que nuestros clientes tienen de nuestro despacho, por lo que una buena imagen y una actitud proactiva son fundamentales.

Responsabilidades

Las principales funciones del recepcionista incluirán, pero no se limitarán a:


Atender y gestionar las llamadas telefónicas, asegurando que las consultas sean dirigidas al departamento correspondiente de manera eficiente.
Recibir a los clientes y visitantes, proporcionando un servicio excepcional desde el primer contacto.
Gestionar la correspondencia y otros documentos administrativos necesarios para el funcionamiento diario del despacho.
Facilitar información sobre nuestros servicios a clientes potenciales, aprovechando las dotes comerciales para identificar oportunidades de negocio.
Colaborar con el equipo administrativo en diversas tareas administrativas que contribuyan al funcionamiento del despacho.
Mantener la recepción y las áreas comunes en condiciones óptimas de presentación y organización.


Requisitos


Experiencia mínima de 1 año en un puesto similar, preferentemente en el sector jurídico o administrativo.
Excelente capacidad de comunicación verbal y escrita en español, así como habilidades de atención al cliente.
Presentar una buena imagen y vestimenta adecuada para el entorno profesional.
Capacidad para trabajar de manera autónoma y gestionar múltiples tareas en un entorno ágil.
Dotes comerciales y habilidades en el manejo de teléfonos, con un enfoque proactivo para resolver inquietudes de los clientes.
Conocimientos básicos de herramientas informáticas y de gestión de agendas.


Condiciones


Se ofrece un contrato de formación, lo que brinda la oportunidad de adquirir nuevos conocimientos y habilidades mientras se trabaja en un ambiente profesional.
La jornada laboral será completa, con horarios flexibles que se coordinarán según las necesidades del despacho y las capacidades del candidato.


Por qué trabajar con nosotros

En CENTRO DE ESTUDIOS SOCRATES SL, valoramos el desarrollo y crecimiento de nuestros colaboradores. Ofrecemos un ambiente de trabajo inclusivo, donde se fomenta el aprendizaje continuo. Creemos en la importancia de ofrecer oportunidades de desarrollo profesional a través de un contrato de formación que permitirá al candidato en esta posición adquirir habilidades y conocimientos específicos del sector.

Forma parte de un equipo comprometido con la excelencia y la atención al cliente en el ámbito jurídico. Te invitamos a ser parte de nuestra misión, donde tu contribución diaria será valorada y podrás crecer tanto personal como profesionalmente.

Si estás preparado para un nuevo desafío y cumples con los requisitos mencionados, te invitamos a considerar esta oportunidad de empleo.

Title: ML Engineer
Description:
Company Description

As an NIQ company, we are the world's leading consumer intelligence firm, delivering the Full View™ on consumer behavior. We work to enable manufacturers and retailers better understand what consumers really want. Our name has inspired trust for over 89 years because we take pride in discovering new pathways to sustainable growth for our clients, our people, and our planet.

We are always looking for open-minded people who will grow with us, push boundaries, and pioneer disruptive methods in market research, data science, technology, and AI. If you share this passion to drive things forward and the integrity to insist on doing things the right way, we'll equip you to take your future into your own hands and play a leading role in our story.

Job Description

Mission


Develop Marketing Science solutions in the area of media analytics
Support the product development during concept testing phases, scaling and production
Transform proofs-of-concept into scalable, production-ready code


Responsibilities


Develop, implement and standardize marketing science solutions in proofs-of-concept and prototypes
Continuously improve the efficiency of the marketing science products (e.g. ensure quality by adherence to coding guidelines, documentation and reproducibility)
Optimize marketing science models using code optimization, high-performance computing and real-time techniques
Build analytical pipelines at scale using cloud services, containerized applications and distributed systems
Identify best practices and create continuous improvement of tools and methods
Closely collaborate with Product Owners, Modellers, Marketing Scientists and Front End Software Engineers


Qualifications


Bachelor or Master degree that reflects strong statistical/mathematical/computer science skills
Strong expertize in Python usage - at least 3 years of development
Understanding of R
Experienced in statistical modelling on top of predictive modeling
Able to manage code deployments (experience with GIT)
Basic understanding of Dockerization – building and managing docker images
Experienced with creating, managing and/or maintaining code documentation
Solid skills concerning performance optimization and scalability (e.g., parallelization, code optimization, functions as a service)
Ability to present and explain complex concepts to less experienced colleagues


Soft Skills


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Able to work independently
Good attention to detail – ensure all outputs are delivered professionally and accurate
Good interpersonal skills – treat others with respect, be cooperative, friendly and considerate of others. Be a good role model, help to build teamwork and team spirit
Well-organised and flexible, and demonstrate self-confidence, decisiveness and commitment able to work alone without constant support, and well organized
Ease of communication in an English-speaking business environment


Additional Information

Hybrid : 1 a week at Madrid office - Flex working mode

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: TÉCNICO/A LABORATORIO GRAUS
Company: Aquaservice - Viva Aqua Service Spain S.A.
Description:
Buscamos para nuestro equipo una persona que pueda estar en el Laboratorio de Calidad de nuestra planta de producción de Graus.

Te responsabilizarás de la gestión de calidad de nuestro agua en nuestro centro de producción.

- Recogida de muestras.

- Análisis de las mismas, mediante análisis microbiológicos y fisicoquímicos.

- Inspección de materias primas.

- Realización de informes.

- Gestión documentación para auditorías.

- Disponibilidad para Viajar a otras plantas.

Requisitos:
- Necesitamos que tengas formación en Grado o FP en Ciencia y Tecnología de los Alimentos, Biología, Ingeniería Química o Bioquímica.
- Manejo de paquete office.
- Con posibilidad de realizar los 3 turnos: de 6:00 a 14:00h, de 14:00h a 22:00h y de 22:00 a 6:00
- Residencia cerca de la planta o disponibilidad geográfica.



Se ofrece:

- Horario en turnos rotativos de mañana /tarde y noche.
- Formación Continua y desarrollo profesional dentro de la empresa
- Contrato de mayo a septiembre

Title: Data Scientist (Full Remote within Spain)
Description:
About Us

At Leadtech, we've been redefining digital businesses since 2009, creating innovative online solutions that reach millions of users every month. With a diverse team of over 700 members from 23+ nationalities, we're united by a passion for creativity and collaboration.

We specialize in delivering user-centric experiences across web and mobile platforms, where people can connect with our products like never before.

We're proud of our global reach and committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where every individual contributes to our shared vision of bringing cutting-edge projects to life. Learn more about our journey and mission on our About Us page!

About The Role

Due to continuous growth, our Business Intelligence team is excited to welcome a motivated Data Scientist to help us align our work with business goals to drive organizational success.

As a Data Scientist, you'll play a vital role in big data analysis and be responsible for maintaining and enhance data quality. Working closely with key stakeholders, you'll have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on both our products and processes.

If you're passionate about solving complex problems, collaborating across departments, and driving results, this role is perfect for you!

YOUR MISSION

As a Data Scinetist at Leadtech, you will:


Conduct thorough data analysis to identify patterns, trends, and improvement opportunities within datasets
Create effective reports and visualizations to communicate key findings to the company's teams and support data-informed decision-making
Calculate and apply algorithms to predict Customer Lifetime Value (CLTV)
Collaborate closely with business intelligence specialists, data scientists and other team members to develop predictive models and data-driven solutions
Perform ad-hoc research to address specific business-related questions
Continually maintain and enhance data quality, ensuring data integrity and accuracy
Participate in the identification and collection of new data relevant to business objectives
Contribute to the evaluation of new tools and technologies for data management and analysis
Strong analytical skills
Outstanding oral and written communication skills as well as interpersonal skills



Requirements

WHAT WILL MAKE YOU STAND OUT FROM THE CROWD

We're looking for someone with a balance of hard and soft skills who can thrive in a dynamic, cross-functional environment. Here's what we'd love to see:


Bachelor's degree in a related field, such as Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering (Industrial Engineering, Telecommunications Engineering), or a similar discipline
Demonstrated experience in Data Science environment
Solid knowledge of data science/analysis tools, such as KNIME, SPSS, or similar tools
Ability to develop, train, and optimize machine learning models
Experience in predictive modeling, time series analysis, or cluster analysis
Experience in calculating and applying algorithms to predict Customer Lifetime Value (CLTV)
Ability to tackle complex problems, identify patterns, and design creative data-driven solutions
Commitment to continuous learning and staying updated with the latest trends in technology and data science
Experience with databases and query languages, such as SQL
Ability to create effective visualizations using tools like Qlik Sense, QlikView or similar
Strong communication skills and the ability to translate technical findings into clear business recommendations
Teamwork and collaboration skills to work closely with other data professionals and cross-functional teams
Proactive attitude and results-oriented



Benefits

WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN US?

Growth and career development


At Leadtech, we prioritize your growth. Enjoy a flexible career path with personalized internal training and an annual budget for external learning opportunities



Work-Life balance


Benefit from a flexible schedule with flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. start, 3:30 - 6 p.m. end) and the option of working full remote or from our Barcelona office. Enjoy free Friday afternoons with a 7-hour workday, plus a 35-hour workweek in July and August so you can savor summer!



Comprehensive Benefits


Competitive salary, full-time permanent contract, and top-tier private health insurance (including dental and psychological services)
25 days of vacation plus your birthday off, with flexible vacation options—no blackout days!



Unique Perks


If you wish to come, in our office in Barcelona you'll find it complete with free coffee, fresh fruit, snacks, a game room, and a rooftop terrace with stunning Mediterranean views
Additional benefits include ticket restaurant and nursery vouchers, paid directly from your gross salary


Join us in an environment where you're free to innovate, learn, and grow alongside passionate professionals. At Leadtech, you'll tackle exciting challenges and be part of a vibrant team dedicated to delivering exceptional user experiences

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer:

"Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expressión and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be a part of a great project!"

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.
Show more

  • At Leadtech, we prioritize your growth. Enjoy a flexible career path with personalized internal training and an annual budget for external learning opportunities


Work-Life balance

  • Benefit from a flexible schedule with flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. start, 3:30 - 6 p.m. end) and the option of working full remote or from our Barcelona office. Enjoy free Friday afternoons with a 7-hour workday, plus a 35-hour workweek in July and August so you can savor summer!


Comprehensive Benefits

  • Competitive salary, full-time permanent contract, and top-tier private health insurance (including dental and psychological services)
  • 25 days of vacation plus your birthday off, with flexible vacation options—no blackout days!


Unique Perks

  • If you wish to come, in our office in Barcelona you'll find it complete with free coffee, fresh fruit, snacks, a game room, and a rooftop terrace with stunning Mediterranean views
  • Additional benefits include ticket restaurant and nursery vouchers, paid directly from your gross salary

Join us in an environment where you're free to innovate, learn, and grow alongside passionate professionals. At Leadtech, you'll tackle exciting challenges and be part of a vibrant team dedicated to delivering exceptional user experiences

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer:

"Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expressión and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be a part of a great project!"

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

Title: Area Manager
Description:
¡Somos Singularu y hacemos joyas para que todo el mundo pueda brillar! 💍💞

Singularu es una marca joven, llena de ambición, con un equipo de más de 250 personas que trabajamos con un solo objetivo: dar a nuestras/os clientas/os el mejor servicio, experiencia de compra y por supuesto, las mejores joyas a nuestras clientas. ¡Queremos que todas/os puedan llevar piezas únicas! 💎💗

¿Qué funciones llevarás a cabo como Área Manager?


Alcanzar los objetivos de negocio en términos de ventas, productividad, rentabilidad, posicionamiento e imagen a través de la implementación de la estrategia comercial en cada punto de venta.
Analizar y conocer el mercado y la competencia existente o potencial, definiendo acciones que permitan aumentar la cuota de mercado y el posicionamiento de la compañía.
Apoyar en la elaboración, seguimiento y control del presupuesto anual de la zona, garantizando que se logren los objetivos establecidos.
Analizar los indicadores comerciales (KPIs) de ventas, ratios y gastos por zona y tienda, para actuar sobre las desviaciones negativas con planes de acción concretos.
Coordinar e implementar las acciones comerciales necesarias para obtener los objetivos fijados durante la temporada: promociones, rebajas.
Supervisar los ratios de medición de la calidad de la atención a las Clientas, y asegurar una experiencia extraordinaria en el servicio prestado.
Garantizar el stock de la zona gestionando las incidencias de inventario trabajando con el responsable de producto.
Velar por la imagen de Singularu en la zona y realizar el seguimiento de las tiendas a través de visitas estructuradas que analicen de forma global su correcto funcionamiento y permitan la realización de planes de acción concretos.
Selección, motivación y formación del personal de su zona con el fin de asegurar un nivel de desempeño y de calidad excelentes.
Transmitir los objetivos y la estrategia del área a los equipos, realizando seguimiento de la ejecución posterior.
Velar porque las clientas tengan una excelente experiencia de compra que otorgue como retorno una mayor fidelización hacia la firma.
Implementar y mantener las políticas y procesos establecidos por la compañía.



¿Qué necesitamos de ti?❣️


Gran capacidad de liderazgo y comunicación, así como de resolución de problemas.
Conocimientos analíticos y estratégicos.
Alta capacidad de trabajo en equipo.



Hard skills:


Manejo avanzado de Microsoft Excel.
Manejo de KPI's.
Titulación universitaria: grado en ADE, Economía, Derecho u otra titulación similar.
Valorable positivamente alto nivel de inglés, portugués, francés.
Disponibilidad total para viajar.



Te ofrecemos 🎀


Posibilidad de crecimiento dentro del equipo
Equipo joven y dinámico en constante aprendizaje dentro del sector Retail y joyero
Descuento exclusivo en joyas
Plan de retribución flexible



Nuestros valores como equipo 🚀

💍 OUR GIRLS ALWAYS COME FIRST

💕 TEAM WORK, DREAM WORK

⚙ TRUST THE PROCESS

✨ ALWAYS PROACTIVE & POSITIVE

🙌 ENJOY ALL OF IT

En Singularu, lo que nos hace brillar por fuera y por dentro son nuestros valores. Por eso, nos comprometemos a hacer de nuestra empresa un espacio donde la igualdad de oportunidades y la diversidad van primero. 💖

¡Únete al brillo Singularu y envíanos tu CV si te sientes identificado/a con la vacante! ✨

Title: Dependiente/a
Description:
Se busca dependiente para estanco ubicado en la zona de Valdebernardo, Madrid con jornada parcial de 36 horas semanales y, con posibilidad de contrato indefinido, tras aprobar el período de prueba.

Se requiere **disponibilidad inmediata tanto por la mañana como por la tarde**, así como los fines de semana y festivos.

Las funciones a ejercer son: atención al cliente, reposición de stock, realización y acomodo de pedidos, limpieza, trazabilidad, análisis de faltantes, entre otros.

Indispensable: buena imagen, puntualidad, responsabilidad y honestidad. **Se dará preferencia a quienes tengan experiencia en el ámbito de los estancos.**

Title: TÉCNICO/A DE SELECCIÓN - SEDE CENTRAL - JORNADA COMPLETA - INDEFINIDO
Description:
CARGO TÉCNICO/A DE SELECCIÓN - SEDE CENTRAL - JORNADA COMPLETA - INDEFINIDO UBICACIÓN Madrid, Vallecas DESCRIPCIÓN DEL PUESTO Asociación Centro Trama es una Organización no Gubernamental cuyo objetivo básico es la defensa de los derechos humanos y la mejora de la calidad de vida de los colectivos socialmente desfavorecidos.

En Asociación Centro Trama, en la gestión de sus Recursos Humanos, buscamos tener la persona adecuada con independencia de cuál sea su origen, sexo, religión y orientación sexual en cada uno de los puestos de trabajo. Integramos la igualdad de trato y oportunidades entre mujeres y hombres como principio de todos los procesos de Recursos Humanos dentro de la organización.

¿Te encanta descubrir talento y conectar a las personas con su trabajo ideal? Si te apasiona la selección de personal y quieres formar parte de nuestro equipo… ¡Sigue leyendo!.

¿CUALES SERÁN TUS FUNCIONES?


Llevarás procesos de selección de principio a fin: desde la publicación de ofertas hasta la incorporación.
Usarás herramientas innovadoras para atraer talento (y sí, LinkedIn será tu segunda casa).
Colaborarás con los coordinadores y equipos para entender qué tipo de perfil necesitan realmente.
Trabajarás de la mano del departamento laboral para dar de alta a las nuevas personas que se incorporen.
Pensarás fuera de la caja para mejorar la experiencia del candidato y optimizar procesos.


¿QUÉ TE OFRECEMOS?


Un ambiente de trabajo dinámico.
Posición indefinida con una jornada semanal de 38.5h.
Trabajo presencial en nuestras oficinas centrales (calle Pozazal número 4, Vallecas).
Horario de 8 a 16h, excepto los viernes de 8 a 15h.
23 días de vacaciones + 2 de asuntos propios.
Salario según el Convenio de Trama, 1b.


REQUISITOS ¿QUÉ BUSCAMOS?


Un/a profesional con un año de experiencia en selección de personal (muy valorable en el tercer sector).
Estar en posesión de un grado de ciencias sociales y/o Psicología, Recursos humanos...


COMPETENCIAS Capacidad para gestionar varios procesos a la vez

Ganas de innovar, aportar ideas y mejorar cada día

Habilidades de comunicación y empatía FECHA DE CIERRE 31 de diciembre de 2025

Title: Data Scientist - Data Science (Openbank)
Description:
Country: Spain

Join Openbank, the 100% digital bank of the Santander Group, where innovation meets opportunity! With over 2 million customers across Spain, Germany, the Netherlands, Portugal, we're leading the way in digital banking. From loans and mortgages to a cutting-edge, fully automated investment platform, our products are transforming the industry.

At Openbank, we pride ourselves on simplicity, agility, and security, earning us the title of the most recommended Spanish bank among our customers. Technology is in our DNA and we are constantly developing new digital solutions and products. And we're not stopping there! At Openbank we are proud to be a bank that is gaining more and more international presence, we have just landed in the United States and Mexico.

Mission and responsibilities:

As a Data Scientist, you will play a role in interpreting and analyzing complex data from various business areas. Your primary focus will be on leveraging advanced analytics techniques to uncover insights, identify trends, and drive data-driven decision-making processes.

The main tasks of this position will be the following:


Collect and interpret data from various sources within the AWS Datalake to generate actionable insights.
Analyze results from diverse commercial actions to identify opportunities for business optimization, leveraging advanced analytics techniques.
Develop end-to-end Machine Learning models to optimize business processes.
Communicate findings effectively through reports and data visualization tools.
Identify patterns and trends in datasets, automate routine tasks, and focus efforts on analyzing anomalous or unexpected patterns.
Design and implement new data collection and analysis processes tailored to business verticals such as Wealth and new geographic markets.
Locate and propose opportunities for process enhancements to improve efficiency and outcomes.
Develop and implement scripts or dashboards to streamline recurring tasks and support scalability.
Generate comprehensive documentation of all processes to ensure knowledge transfer, easy understanding, and secure backup.


To be successful in the role you must have:


+3 years of experience working on a team with experience understanding risk/ portfolio construction and analytics; predictive modelling, and Machine Learning applications.
University or Master’s Degree in Computer Science / Telecom. / Maths / Physics / Industrial engineer.
Strong programming skills for data analytics and Machine Learning/AI.
Strong Python and PySpark skills – knowledge of data management.
Experience with SQL for managing and accessing data.
Familiarity with software development tools such as GitHub.
Excellent communication/ presentation skills, confidence, and ability to influence, coach, educate fundamental PMs. Outstanding written and oral communication skills
Interest in learning from other Data Science experts, using feedback to improve analysis and understanding of strategies.
Attention to detail and passion/ grit for getting things done, digging into problems, and helping develop solutions.
Sense of ownership and entrepreneurialism to grow business.
Strong knowledge and/or experience on project management, PMI Certification will be a plus.
Knowledge of the Agile framework.


What do we offer?


Joining a dynamic and agile company undergoing international expansion.
Working in start-up mode with the support of the Santander Group.
Competitive remuneration and attractive benefits package.
Possibility of growth within the company and the Group.
Collaborating on international projects in different countries.
Excellent work environment, social clubs and frequent events.


Would you like to grow with us? Join our team!

Openbank is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered as equal without paying attention to gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, age, political orientation, union membership nor disability status.

We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify, and build.

The personal data you provide as well as any data generated during the selection process are confidential and will be processed by Open Bank, S.A./ Open Digital Services, S.L. with registered office at Plaza de Santa Bárbara 2, 28004 (Madrid), for the sole purpose of managing your participation in the selection processes and, where appropriate, to formalise your recruitment. 

For further information about your rights and data protection, please read the ODS/Openbank Privacy Policy applicable to this type of data processing here. 

#OPENBANK

Title: Product Manager, AI
Description:
Metabase is the easiest way for people to get insights from their data, from tiny startups who get up and running quickly, to major corporations with tens of thousands of users. That's why people love us.

We make a product that is actually pleasurable to use, in a very technical space, serving a range of user personas across our two main lines of business: internal BI and embedded analytics.

Our business is thriving and expanding our product in both depth and breadth. Specifically, we’re growing our AI-backed products and looking for a Product Manager to join our highly technical, UX-appreciative and craftsmanship-aligned team.

PMing at Metabase is a bit different than elsewhere, in how much we emphasize deep understanding of problems, of the technical realities of the product and the importance of delivering reliably simple and user-aligned software. It rewards intellectual curiosity, customer empathy and systematic thinking and doesn’t focus on strict metric optimization or a ship-ship-ship attitude. We ship, but we do it well.

Responsibilities

Like other PMs on the team, this role will need you to:


Develop deep knowledge and empathy for users needs in the areas they tackle. This involves reviewing existing issues, tickets, docs, engaging in lots of interviews and evaluating quantitative data
Understand the underlying mechanics of the product at a technical level. They don’t need to read/write code, but need to have the curiosity and ability to over time understand how things work and develop instincts for what’s easy/hard
Develop strategies for solving clusters of users needs in thoughtful ways, ultimately delivering product docs which frame needs in actionable ways for designers and engineers
Steward projects forward, helping keep focus, momentum, and continuously re-evaluating scope, with flexibility and appreciation for technical constraints and UX considerations
Follow-up on the outcomes of projects they ship, quantitatively and qualitatively
Collaborate with the rest of the team, consistently seeking and providing feedback, as well as pitching ideas for how to advance the product



And specifically to:


Identify opportunities for leveraging ML/LLMs in the product through a mix of strong intuition for use case/solution matches and focused, benchmark-centric experimentation
Nurture the development of AI projects with particularly strong quantified success criteria, like defining benchmark expectations, sourcing benchmark sample data, gauging likely plateaus for improvement, etc
Elevate the broader PM team’s knowledge of how to ship and iterate upon LLM features



Responsibilities don’t include:


Managing people, herding cats, writing code, making mocks, using JIRA



About You


Excited to belly flop into the non-deterministic and reliably unpredictable world of LLM-backed projects
Able and interested in staying up-to-date with developments in the world of LLMs and adjacent technologies, with a bias towards tinkering on your own
A thorough thinker, able to be both diligent with details but systematic to see the big picture
Appreciative of clean but powerful user experiences (and the hard work their require)
Able to keep a vision in mind, but break the path to it into small, doable, valuable steps
Motivated to work asynchronously in a global team, and with the written communication chops to do it effectively
More interested in the Product than the Management part of Product Management



Skills And Experience


3+ years shipping ML products as part of a Product+Eng team, with good understanding of the underlying mechanisms (you can’t just lob requirements over the fence and hope for good things, you need to understand the details)
5+ years as a PM in a technical environment (this is not a role for junior PMs), shipping user-facing software (not just infra). Preference for the analytics/databases/developer tools space, but you can have built any sort of product as long as it had some real technical complexity
Demonstrable experience leveraging LLMs as building blocks in complex workflows (either professionally or in personal projects), with strong understanding of underlying mechanics (aka no simple prompt wrappers)
Driven and experienced in helping others continuously deliver work through influence, not authority
Skills you don't need: up-to-date coding skills, customer management, cloud infra knowledge, horse whispering



When applying, make sure your cover letter and or resume clearly spell out your ML/LLM experience.

We're a global team (50% outside the US), fully distributed (from Thailand to California), who get things done asynchronously, with plenty of uninterrupted time, supporting each other to do the best work of our careers. We offer flexibility (define your own schedule and work from wherever you want), autonomy, and an environment that fosters growth, learning, and development. We're relentlessly user-focused and believe in building long-term value, not short-term hacks. And we raised a $30M Series B to take our approach to the next level for years to come.

For U.S. applicants: Metabase participates in the federal E-Verify program, which confirms employment authorization of newly hired U.S. based employees. E-Verify is not used as a tool to pre-screen candidates and is only initiated upon hire.

E-Verify Participation Notice (English/Spanish)

Right to Work Notice (English/Spanish)
Show more
HTML:
Metabase is the easiest way for people to get insights from their data, from tiny startups who get up and running quickly, to major corporations with tens of thousands of users. That's why people love us.

We make a product that is actually pleasurable to use, in a very technical space, serving a range of user personas across our two main lines of business: internal BI and embedded analytics.

Our business is thriving and expanding our product in both depth and breadth. Specifically, we’re growing our AI-backed products and looking for a Product Manager to join our highly technical, UX-appreciative and craftsmanship-aligned team.

PMing at Metabase is a bit different than elsewhere, in how much we emphasize deep understanding of problems, of the technical realities of the product and the importance of delivering reliably simple and user-aligned software. It rewards intellectual curiosity, customer empathy and systematic thinking and doesn’t focus on strict metric optimization or a ship-ship-ship attitude. We ship, but we do it well.

Responsibilities

Like other PMs on the team, this role will need you to:

  • Develop deep knowledge and empathy for users needs in the areas they tackle. This involves reviewing existing issues, tickets, docs, engaging in lots of interviews and evaluating quantitative data
  • Understand the underlying mechanics of the product at a technical level. They don’t need to read/write code, but need to have the curiosity and ability to over time understand how things work and develop instincts for what’s easy/hard
  • Develop strategies for solving clusters of users needs in thoughtful ways, ultimately delivering product docs which frame needs in actionable ways for designers and engineers
  • Steward projects forward, helping keep focus, momentum, and continuously re-evaluating scope, with flexibility and appreciation for technical constraints and UX considerations
  • Follow-up on the outcomes of projects they ship, quantitatively and qualitatively
  • Collaborate with the rest of the team, consistently seeking and providing feedback, as well as pitching ideas for how to advance the product


And specifically to:

  • Identify opportunities for leveraging ML/LLMs in the product through a mix of strong intuition for use case/solution matches and focused, benchmark-centric experimentation
  • Nurture the development of AI projects with particularly strong quantified success criteria, like defining benchmark expectations, sourcing benchmark sample data, gauging likely plateaus for improvement, etc
  • Elevate the broader PM team’s knowledge of how to ship and iterate upon LLM features


Responsibilities don’t include:

  • Managing people, herding cats, writing code, making mocks, using JIRA


About You

  • Excited to belly flop into the non-deterministic and reliably unpredictable world of LLM-backed projects
  • Able and interested in staying up-to-date with developments in the world of LLMs and adjacent technologies, with a bias towards tinkering on your own
  • A thorough thinker, able to be both diligent with details but systematic to see the big picture
  • Appreciative of clean but powerful user experiences (and the hard work their require)
  • Able to keep a vision in mind, but break the path to it into small, doable, valuable steps
  • Motivated to work asynchronously in a global team, and with the written communication chops to do it effectively
  • More interested in the Product than the Management part of Product Management


Skills And Experience

  • 3+ years shipping ML products as part of a Product+Eng team, with good understanding of the underlying mechanisms (you can’t just lob requirements over the fence and hope for good things, you need to understand the details)
  • 5+ years as a PM in a technical environment (this is not a role for junior PMs), shipping user-facing software (not just infra). Preference for the analytics/databases/developer tools space, but you can have built any sort of product as long as it had some real technical complexity
  • Demonstrable experience leveraging LLMs as building blocks in complex workflows (either professionally or in personal projects), with strong understanding of underlying mechanics (aka no simple prompt wrappers)
  • Driven and experienced in helping others continuously deliver work through influence, not authority
  • Skills you don't need: up-to-date coding skills, customer management, cloud infra knowledge, horse whispering


When applying, make sure your cover letter and or resume clearly spell out your ML/LLM experience.

We're a global team (50% outside the US), fully distributed (from Thailand to California), who get things done asynchronously, with plenty of uninterrupted time, supporting each other to do the best work of our careers. We offer flexibility (define your own schedule and work from wherever you want), autonomy, and an environment that fosters growth, learning, and development. We're relentlessly user-focused and believe in building long-term value, not short-term hacks. And we raised a $30M Series B to take our approach to the next level for years to come.

For U.S. applicants: Metabase participates in the federal E-Verify program, which confirms employment authorization of newly hired U.S. based employees. E-Verify is not used as a tool to pre-screen candidates and is only initiated upon hire.

E-Verify Participation Notice (English/Spanish)

Right to Work Notice (English/Spanish)

Title: TRABAJA CON NOSOTROS Decathlon Logística Madrid Sur
Description:
Al igual que en la elección de tu deporte, queremos acompañarte a que en Decathlon encuentres una oportunidad laboral hecha para ti .

Podrás unirte a un equipo apasionado del deporte que trabaja cada día desde nuestras tiendas, almacenes o servicios centrales para satisfacer a cada uno de los deportistas que nos visitan.

Un equipo conectado, que comparte sus valores, que acerca sus conocimientos a nuestros usuarios deportistas aportando soluciones innovadoras con una servicialidad diferenciadora.

Si te encanta practicar deporte, te sientes identificado/a y no encuentras una oferta en Logística que se adapte a tus necesidades, incluye tu CV´s en nuestra base de datos aplicando a esta oferta.

Requisitos:


Deportista que incorpore el deporte como práctica habitual .

Title: Free Tour Madrid: Tour Guide
Description:
Free Tour Madrid busca un/a Tour Guide

Hay muchas ofertas y actividades para conocer Madrid y sin duda una de las divertidas y documentadas es nuestra ASOCIACIÓN CULTURAL FREE TOUR MADRID. Nuestras paseos a pie abarcan muchos temas y áreas como El Barrio de las Letras, El Madrid de los Austrias, El Madrid Siniestro y mucho más. Nuestros rutas parten de la Plaza Mayor frente a la oficina de información turística donde encontraras a nuestros guías debajo del PARAGUAS BLANCO.


Tareas


Buscamos Licenciados en Historia / Historia del Arte (imprescindible) para guiar grupos en Madrid (Zona Centro) no es necesaria experiencia, necesario DON DE GENTES, Se valoraran ingles y otros idiomas. Contrato de trabajo. Alta en régimen general de la Seguridad Social, Sueldo mínimo interprofesional/hora . Disponibilidad inmediata. Residente en Madrid.


Requisitos


Imprescindible licenciado o diplomado en historia


Beneficios


Contrato Laboral indefinido

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
¿Te apasiona el BigData? ¿Quieres formar parte de un equipo con una de las trayectorias más solventes en el mundo del Machine Learning, Analytics y BigData? ¿Te apetece trabajar en una compañía joven, participativa y especializada?




Para ello solo exigimos un requisito, que tus respuestas a las preguntas anteriores hayan sido: ¡SÍ!




En Mática Partners, trabajamos continuamente para mantenernos a la vanguardia tecnológica, y además somos una empresa People Centric, ponemos al trabajador en el centro de todo lo que hacemos. Creemos en una cultura horizontal, sin egos, en un entorno donde se valoran tanto las ideas como las personas.




Buscamos a un/a Data Scientist con 3 años de experiencia en análisis de datos, apasionado/a por extraer insights y construir modelos de Machine Learning.




¿Qué buscamos?

Experiencia sólida en Python.
Buen dominio de la modularización y la programación orientada a objetos (OOP).
Experiencia trabajando con Git y buenas prácticas de control de versiones.
Conocimiento en tests unitarios y prácticas de CI/CD.
Se valorará positivamente experiencia con Azure Databricks y Azure Machine Learning (Jobs, Pipelines, YAMLs).
Se valorará experiencia con PySpark.
Familiaridad con herramientas de gestión de tareas como Azure DevOps, Jira o similares.
Buen nivel de inglés, tanto oral como escrito.




¿Cómo será tu día a día?

Comenzarás cada jornada con una reunión diaria de seguimiento de proyecto donde compartirás avances, bloqueos y próximos pasos con el equipo.
Tendrás autonomía para organizar tu trabajo, gestionando tus tareas y tiempos de forma flexible, con foco en la entrega de valor y resultados.
Participarás en reuniones de equipo semanales para compartir aprendizajes y fomentar la colaboración.
Te reunirás directamente con el cliente para presentar avances, resolver dudas y entender mejor sus necesidades.




¿Qué ofrecemos?

Contrato indefinido y salario entre los 38.000 y 42.000 euros brutos/año de entrada, ajustado según tu experiencia (nuestro plan de carrera incluye 2 revisiones anuales). También tendrás a tu disposición un plan de formación especializado, participación en la propiedad y los beneficios de Mática: Wetaca gratuito en la oficina dos días a la semana, horario flexible con facilidades para trabajar desde donde quieras, seguro de salud, retribución flexible con Cobee, además de las vacaciones habituales, ofrecemos una semana extra en Navidad y tres días adicionales en Semana Santa. También recibirás un divertido Welcome Kit con portátil (podrás escoger entre varios modelos Mac o Windows), móvil, botella personalizada, auriculares bluetooth y golosinas.




Cuando estés en nuestra oficina, en el centro de Barcelona o Madrid, la fruta, los cafés y los refrescos corren a cuenta de Mática. ¡Ah! Y si eres amante de los animales, te gustará saber esto: ¡nuestras oficinas son Pet-friendly!




Si te interesa, escríbenos por LinkedIn o envía tu CV a seleccion@maticapartners.com




Do you want to be Mática? Be Mática!

Show more

Title: Programa de Talento Joven - Data Analytics
Place: Pozuelo de Alarcón, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
¿Te apasiona el mundo de la tecnología y quieres lanzarte a tu primera experiencia profesional?

¡Esta es tu oportunidad! En Qualentum (empresa del Grupo Proeduca / UNIR) estamos buscando jóvenes con ganas de aprender y progresar en tareas relacionadas con Data Analytics para uno de nuestros principales clientes, una empresa internacional con más de 15.000 empleados, que ofrece servicios financieros (jubilación, pensiones, seguros, banca e inversiones, etc.) a aproximadamente 18 millones de clientes en 10 países diferentes.


¿Lo mejor de todo?💡Te ofrecemos una experiencia única: combinarás formación especializada con prácticas reales en esta importante multinacional. Aprenderás la teoría y la pondrás en práctica al mismo tiempo. ¡Así es como se crece de verdad!

¿Qué te ofrecemos?

📚 Formación gratuita especializada a través del Título Propio Universitario UNIR-Qualentum de Data Analytics, patrocinado por nuestro cliente.
💼 Experiencia práctica: podrás aplicar los conocimientos adquiridos en proyectos reales, trabajando codo a codo con los excelentes profesionales del equipo tecnológico de esta importante empresa.
👩‍🏫 Mentoría: contarás con la guía y apoyo de profesionales experimentados en el sector que te acompañarán durante tu formación y prácticas.
💻 Flexibilidad: posibilidad de trabajo remoto y horarios adaptados a tus estudios.
🌟 Desarrollo profesional: oportunidades reales de incorporación al equipo una vez hayas finalizado tu beca.

¿Qué aprenderás y aplicarás en tu día a día?

🚀 Revisión de documentos convertidos automáticamente al formato Markdown, y realización de las correcciones necesarias cuando el proceso automático no alcance la precisión requerida.
📊 Generación de metadatos (p.e. tipo de documento, producto al que hace referencia, etc.) para optimizar el procesamiento y la organización de los documentos convertidos.
🔍 Testeo de la herramienta de chatbot orientada a comerciales, proporcionando feedback y recomendaciones para optimizar su funcionamiento.
🤝 Colaboración con el equipo de IA para garantizar que los documentos revisados cumplen con los estándares de calidad necesarios.

¿Qué necesitas para aplicar?

📖 Haber finalizado estudios de Ingeniería Informática, Matemáticas, Estadística o algún otro estudio superior relacionado. ¡Si tienes pasión por el mundo de los Datos y la IA, esto es para ti!
🗣️ Capacidad analítica y comunicativa.
👩‍🏫 Buen nivel de inglés (B2 o superior)
🔍 Interés en Inteligencia Artificial y Análisis de Datos. 
🚀 Motivación para trabajar en un entorno tecnológico.
🤝 Proactividad, trabajo en equipo y capacidad de concentración.
🎨 Buena comprensión lectora, atención al detalle y habilidades organizativas.

¿Te interesa?

¡No lo pienses más! Si te gustan los retos, quieres aprender y formar parte de un gran equipo, ¡estamos deseando conocerte y empezar esta aventura juntos! 🚀



El Grupo EDUCATIVO está firmemente comprometido con la igualdad de oportunidades y la diversidad, logrando con ello crear un entorno libre de toda discriminación.

Title: Encargado/a
Description:
¿Te Apasionan Los Nuevos Retos y Quieres Seguir Creciendo En Una Empresa En Plena Expansión? ¡TÚ ERES NUESTRO ENCARGADO! Como Encargado, Serás Un Miembro Clave De Nuestro Equipo De Gestión, Trabajando De Cerca Con El Store Manager Para Garantizar Un Funcionamiento Eficiente y De Alta Calidad De Nuestro Establecimiento. Responsabilidades Principales


Supervisar y coordinar las operaciones diarias del restaurante, asegurando la excelencia en la calidad del servicio y la satisfacción de los clientes.
Capacitar y dirigir al equipo de empleados, motivándolos para alcanzar los objetivos y garantizar un ambiente de trabajo positivo.
Implementar y hacer cumplir los estándares operacionales.
Realizar inventarios regulares
Gestionar el servicio al cliente, atendiendo de manera eficiente cualquier problema o consulta.
Colaborar con el Store Manager para alcanzar los objetivos de ventas y rentabilidad del negocio.
Participar en el reclutamiento y selección de nuevos miembros del equipo, brindando capacitación y orientación adecuada. Requisitos:
Experiencia previa en roles de supervisión o gestión en restauración.
Fuertes habilidades de liderazgo y capacidad para motivar y guiar a un equipo.
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación y capacidad para trabajar en equipo.
Orientación al cliente y enfoque en la satisfacción del mismo.
Conocimientos básicos de gestión y control de costos.
Capacidad para trabajar en un entorno de ritmo rápido y bajo presión.
Pasión por la industria de la restauración y disposición para aprender y crecer profesionalmente.


Ofrecemos


Oportunidades de crecimiento y desarrollo profesional en una compañía en expansión
Ambiente de trabajo dinámico y divertido, donde se valora el espíritu de equipo y la pasión por la excelencia.
Jornada total o parcial y turnos rotativos
Dos días libres
Remuneración competitiva.
Formación continua y oportunidades de desarrollo personal.


Si estás listo para asumir un nuevo desafío y crecer en el mundo de la restauración esperamos contar con tu talento y entusiasmo. TONY ROMA´S es una organización comprometida con la diversidad, equidad y la inclusión. Todos nuestros procesos de selección se llevaran a cabo tenido en cuenta estos criterios

Title: Research Data Analyst (Remote - California)
Description:
About Jobgether

Jobgether is a Talent Matching Platform that partners with companies worldwide to efficiently connect top talent with the right opportunities through AI-driven job matching.

One of our companies is currently looking for a Research Data Analyst in California.

This role involves leading data collection, analysis, and reporting initiatives that drive institutional research, planning, and effectiveness. As a Research Data Analyst, you will work closely with internal teams to translate complex datasets into actionable insights that align with organizational goals and improve student success metrics. Your expertise in both quantitative and qualitative research methods will support curriculum evaluation, enrollment trends, student outcomes, and accreditation reporting. The ideal candidate is data-driven, detail-oriented, and passionate about using analytics to support decision-making in higher education environments.

Accountabilities:


Collect, analyze, and interpret data related to student success, enrollment, retention, curriculum, and institutional effectiveness
Design and manage structured research projects using statistical and analytical tools (e.g., R, SAS, SPSS)
Create visualizations, dashboards, and reports to communicate findings to a variety of stakeholders
Support planning, accreditation, and grant-related initiatives with data analysis and policy recommendations
Collaborate across departments to support program evaluation, decision-making, and continuous improvement
Develop surveys, conduct structured interviews and focus groups, and perform literature and policy reviews
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of institutional and external data systems, ensuring data quality and integrity



Requirements


Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Public Policy, Economics, or a related field
Minimum of 2 years of experience working with higher education data and research tools
Strong proficiency in data visualization and statistical analysis tools (e.g., Excel, Google Sheets, SAS, SPSS, R)
Experience querying and analyzing structured data from relational databases using SQL or similar languages
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to translate complex data for non-technical audiences
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects under tight deadlines and work both independently and collaboratively
Desired: Experience with Qualtrics, Salesforce, LMS, predictive analytics, and programming languages like Python



Benefits


Competitive salary range: $97,721.88 - $107,756.75 annually (based on experience and step placement)
Remote position based in California, offering flexibility and a tech-forward work environment
Strong emphasis on work-life balance with supportive management and clear mission-driven goals
Opportunities for ongoing training, professional development, and career advancement
Inclusive culture committed to diversity, equity, and representation across all levels
Participation in public sector retirement programs and comprehensive health benefits
Ability to contribute to impactful projects shaping the future of accessible online education



Jobgether Hiring Process Disclaimer

This job is posted on behalf of one of our partner companies. If you choose to apply, your application will go through our AI-powered 3-step screening process, where we automatically select the 5 best candidates.

Our AI thoroughly analyzes every line of your CV and LinkedIn profile to assess your fit for the role, evaluating each experience in detail. When needed, our team may also conduct a manual review to ensure only the most relevant candidates are considered.

Our process is fair, unbiased, and based solely on qualifications and relevance to the job. Only the best-matching candidates will be selected for the next round.

If you are among the top 5 candidates, you will be notified within 7 days.

If you do not receive feedback after 7 days, it means you were not selected. However, if you wish, we may consider your profile for other similar opportunities that better match your experience.

Thank you for your interest!
